main event: An oval-shaped object about 10-12 feet in diameter was observed moving at high speed from south to north at an altitude of 500-800 feet for about 5-10 seconds.
interesting points: The object moved across the sky with no observed trail, sound, or maneuvering.
The witness was unable to make out any details of the object beyond it being a point of light.
The witness compared the object's brightness and visibility to a car headlight.
The object was observed moving westward along the horizon and then disappearing into a bank of fog.
The witness noted the weather conditions as clear, cold, with a half-moon and many stars visible.
result: Possibly a Balloon, No Further Investigation Indicated
sighted object: An oval-shaped object about 10-12 feet in diameter
